page.title: 14Gumley Rectory.
page.content: { Gumley Rectory}was built in 1869 to replace the old rectory which was pulled down to enlarge Gumley Hall. It was used for storing medical supplies during the second world war.A retired colonel owns the rectory now.In summer he spends much of his time at Cannes on his boat,but in winter he stays at the rectory for the{fox-hunting. There are 3 different hunts,Fernie, Quorn and Pytchley.The Colonel is the Chairman of the Fernie Hunt.He was Master of the Hunt from 1960 to 1983.The hounds are kept at kennels at Great Bowden.They hunt twice a week on Wednesdays and Saturdays.The season starts at the end of October and ends in March.Hunting is one of the popular {customs}in Gumley & Laughton.The hunt has many followers. Foxes are plenti- ful in the area.The Westerby Bassett hounds are used for{hare-hunting.
